groups.name: Science (Physics)
texts: Einstein's theory of general relativity describes gravity as a curvature of spacetime.
Quantum mechanics deals with the behavior of matter and energy at the atomic and subatomic levels.
Newton's third law states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
The Schr√∂dinger equation is a mathematical equation that describes the changes over time of a physical system in which quantum effects are significant.

groups.name: Technology (Software)
texts: An API (Application Programming Interface) allows different software applications to communicate with each other.
Version control systems like Git are essential for collaborative software development.
An algorithm is a finite sequence of well-defined instructions, typically used to solve a class of specific problems or to perform a computation.
Object-oriented programming is a programming paradigm based on the concept of 'objects', which can contain data and code.

groups.name: Finance (Investing)
texts: Diversification is a strategy of investing in a variety of assets to reduce risk.
The stock market is where investors buy and sell shares of publicly traded companies.
Inflation erodes the purchasing power of money over time.
A bond is a fixed-income instrument that represents a loan made by an investor to a borrower.

groups.name: History (Ancient Rome)
texts: The Roman Empire was one of the most powerful empires in world history, lasting for over a thousand years.
Julius Caesar was a Roman general and statesman who played a critical role in the events that led to the demise of the Roman Republic.
The Colosseum is an oval amphitheater in the center of the city of Rome, Italy, built of travertine limestone, tuff, and brick-faced concrete.
Latin was the language of the Roman Empire and the ancestor of the Romance languages.

groups.name: Literature (Classics)
texts: William Shakespeare is widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language.
George Orwell's novel 'Nineteen Eighty-Four' is a dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale.
To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee is a novel about the seriousness of racial inequality.
Moby Dick, by Herman Melville, is the story of a vengeful sea captain's hunt for a giant whale.

groups.name: Health & Medicine
texts: Vaccines work by stimulating the immune system to produce antibodies without causing the illness.
DNA, or deoxyribonucleic acid, is the hereditary material in humans and almost all other organisms.
A balanced diet and regular exercise are crucial for maintaining good physical health.
Antibiotics are medications that destroy or slow down the growth of bacteria.
